feed.title: Moving towards user activated soft fork activation

entry.title: Moving towards user activated soft fork activation
entry.summary: The context discusses the idea of a User Activated Soft Fork (UASF) and its potential success or failure based on coin price and economic value. There is a debate between two individuals, Alice and Bob, regarding the validity of different forks of Blahcoin and what principles they represent. The conversation highlights the subjective nature of opinions and beliefs, and the lack of an objective measure to resolve disputes. Another email in the thread proposes a plan for a UASF with a gradual rollout over 12 months to increase adoption and minimize risk. The email suggests that obtaining support from major economic hubs is crucial for the success of the UASF. Overall, the emails discuss the potential risks and benefits of a UASF compared to other types of forks.
